newsitem.title: UK: Hong Kong stocks in London lower in slack trade.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong stocks in London lower in slack trade.

text.p: Hong Kong stocks in London slipped back by early afternoon after the Hang Seng closed at its fourth straight record on Monday.
The Hang Seng London Reference index was trading down 51.43 points at 13,816.81 by 12.40 GMT. In Hong Kong on Monday, the Hang Seng index closed 11.84 points higher at 13,868.24.
The main mover was Hang Seng Bank, down 0.75 at 95, which caused a flurry of interest and pulled other shares lower. But trade was generally quiet.
"The mood is very cautious. No one is willing to commit themselves one way or the other," one trader said.
